adjectives.description: fried (comparative more fried, superlative most fried)

entries.meaning: (specifically, of an egg) Fried with the yolk unbroken.
examples: He always ate his eggs fried, never scrambled.

entries.meaning: Cooked in a deep fryer or pressure fryer or the like after being coated (breaded) in batter; compare deep-fried.
(colloquial, of computer equipment) Broken as a result of excessive heat or an electrical surge.
examples: It looks like your motherboard is fried.

entries.meaning: Stoned; under the influence of drugs.
examples: Man, I got totally fried on weed at Chad's party.

entries.meaning: Drunk; under the influence of alcohol.
examples: The police had to send a squad car / When Daddy got fried on vodka

entries.meaning: Extremely tired due to exertion or stress; exhausted.
examples: After nearly twelve hours at the office plus a nightmare commute home, I was fried and couldnâ€™t think of anything but sleep.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of fry
